heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 21 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: We are in the midst of one of the longest dry periods recorded.  This dry period is ranked 10th since records began in 23 September 2024.  The current stretch started on 22 September 2025 and has lasted 7 days.  The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 44.9°C), dew point temperature (up 41.3°C), outside temperature (up 45.1°C), and cloud levels (up 808 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 159.4m lower than yesterday, 807.7m lower than the past week, 522.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 741m to a maximum of 2070m, averaging 1165.0m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1972.7m and 1687.4m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; relatively cool weather. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and winds will be practically absent. Chance of light rain, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and it’s dim outside. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (87%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
